item.description:
﻿ If interested in the following, please put yourself on the established waiting list. A yes list will be provided as soon as possible.

 

Criteria: NO WHINING, COMPLAINING, ETC. All hikers must be able to maintain a minimum pace of three miles an hour for a minimum of four hours. All hikers must have cold weather gear and be experienced above treeline in winter conditions. All hikers must have map & compass skills along with being prepared to spend an emergency night out in the woods. All attendees must read, understand and agree to the waiver/liability as outlined by this website. starting at Al Merrill Loop Trailhead and Gorge Brook Trailhead Back to here hike 0.05 mi/2 min/+8 ft on the Gorge Brook Trail Leaving the turnaround at the end of Ravine Lodge Rd., it follows the gravel logging road for 100 yd. to the junction of Al Merrill Loop hike 0.15 mi/5 min/-113 ft on the Gorge Brook Trail Then the trail turns left, descends to Baker River and crosses it on a footbridge, and immediately turns left where the Asquam-Ridge Trail diverges right. to the junction of Asquam Ridge Trail hike 0.05 mi/2 min/+5 ft on the Gorge Brook Trail In a short distance, the Hurricane Trail continues straight ahead, whereas the Gorge Brook Trail turns sharp right uphill and follows Gorge Brook, then crosses it on a bridge. to the junction of Hurricane Trail hike 0.35 mi/19 min/+277 ft on the Gorge Brook Trail The relocated Snapper Trail diverges on the left just past this bridge, while the Gorge Brook Trail continues close to the brook and recrosses it on another bridge. to the junction of Snapper Trail hike 3.10 mi/2 hr 38 min/+2139 ft on the Gorge Brook Trail Then the trail passes the memorial plaque for the Ross McKenney Forest; here the new route begins and swings well to the right of the former route. It turns left onto an old logging road, passes a cleared outlook to the south, then turns left off the road and winds uphill at moderate grades, passing more outlooks to the south and east. It reaches a shoulder covered with low scrub that affords a view to the summit ahead and soon breaks into the open on the grassy ridge crest. It continues to the base of the summit rocks, then clambers up the last rocky 50 yd. to the summit. to Mt Moosilauke Totals Distance 3.70 mi Time 3 hr 6 min Elev Gain +2461 ft Elev Loss -145 ft Elev Change +2316 ft Driving Directions Show in Google Earth Download to GPS Back to here hike 0.90 mi/38 min/-344 ft on the Moosilauke Carriage Road The Moosilauke Carriage Road starts at the summit of Moosilauke and descends the windswept ridge down to treeline. It continues on an old road, now part of the AT, along the ridge, with a narrow fringe of trees on each side. It then reaches the Glencliff Trail which diverges to the right. A few steps along the Glencliff Trail, a spur trail leads left to South Peak, a fine viewpoint. to the junction of Glencliff Trail and South Peak, Mt Moosilauke spur hike 0.20 mi/8 min/+77 ft on the South Peak, Mt Moosilauke spur Totals Distance 4.80 mi Time 3 hr 52 min Elev Gain +2562 ft Elev Loss -513 ft Elev Change +2049 ft Driving Directions Show in Google Earth Download to GPS Back to here hike 0.20 mi/8 min/-77 ft on the South Peak, Mt Moosilauke spur to the junction of Glencliff Trail and Moosilauke Carriage Road hike 1.20 mi/1 hr 9 min/-1091 ft on the Moosilauke Carriage Road The Carriage Road descends to the south, soon passing a row of boulders that prevent vehicular use on the upper mountain. As it continues to descend, there are occasional views to the south and east. This section of the road has been widened and improved, eliminating what was formerly a washed-out section with poor footing. to the junction of Snapper Trail hike 1.10 mi/55 min/-704 ft on the Snapper Trail From its junction with the Moosilauke Carriage Rd., the Snapper Trail crosses the old trail route and angles down the slope in a northeast direction at a moderate grade. It crosses a tributary, swings left, then right, crosses another tributary, then descends along its bank to its junction with the Gorge Brook Trail. to the junction of Gorge Brook Trail hike 0.35 mi/19 min/-277 ft on the Gorge Brook Trail The Gorge Brook Trail continues close to the brook. The relocated Snapper Trail diverges on the right, and the Gorge Brook Trail and crosses the Gorge Brook on the bridge. to the junction of Hurricane Trail hike 0.05 mi/2 min/-5 ft on the Gorge Brook Trail The Gorge Brook Trail crosses Gorge Brook on a bridge then turns sharp left where the Hurricane Trail diverges to the right. to the junction of Asquam Ridge Trail hike 0.15 mi/5 min/+113 ft on the Gorge Brook Trail The trail passes to the left of the Asquam-Ridge Trail, and crosses the Baker River on a footbridge. to the junction of Al Merrill Loop hike 0.05 mi/2 min/-8 ft on the Gorge Brook Trail It follows the gravel logging road for 100 yd., arriving at the turnaround at the end of Ravine Lodge Rd. to Al Merrill Loop Trailhead and Gorge Brook Trailhead Totals Distance 7.90 mi Time 6 hr 32 min Elev Gain +2710 ft Elev Loss -2710 ft Elev Change 0 ft
item.how_to_find_us: WE WILL BE IN A SILVER SUBARU
item.name: ITS A GREAT HIKE
